page.title: 01BATH, GEORGIAN CITY
page.content: The second largest town in the county of Avon,Bath is set in a hollow of the hills on a curve of the River Avon,107 miles west of London,12 miles east of Bristol.It has a population of over 80,000 and covers 7100 acres;a fashionable resort from the time of the Romans with hot baths and mineral waters.The Romans called Bath{Aquae {Sulis}.In the 18th Century,under{Beau {Nash},the "King of Bath",Bath was transformed by new streets and buildings and people flocked to it "to take the waters." Because of this Bath has become a world wide tourist attraction.Today,Bath has shops of tremendous diversity,also three cinemas,museums,a wealth of parks,a modern sports centre,an historic theatre and the {Bath Festival},one of Europe's leading music festivals.
